title: Dragen3D: Multiview Geometry Consistent 3D Gaussian Generation with Drag-Based Control
author: Jinbo Yan (Tencent, China), Alan Zhao (Tencent, China), Yixin Hu (Tencent America, USA), ...
relevance_why: The methods for 3D Gaussian generation and manipulation could enhance audio-visual integration tasks where spatially consistent 3D models are required, applicable in audio-visual synthesis.
background: Generating 3D models from single-view images while ensuring geometric consistency across multiple viewpoints and allowing for intuitive user editing.
contribution: This paper introduces the Anchor-GS Variational Autoencoder (VAE) and a Seed-Point-Driven strategy to solve the challenge of controllable geometrically consistent 3D generation, achieving significant improvements in multi-view consistency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often rely on 2D diffusion models that can introduce inconsistencies in multi-view generation and lack direct user control in 3D editing.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work achieves controllable 3D Gaussian generation without the need for 2D priors, enabling intuitive editing through seed point manipulation.

key_innovation: Integrates a unique drag-based editing approach for 3D models that allows users to interactively modify geometries linked to latent representations.
real_world_impact: This approach enhances creative processes in 3D modeling and digital content creation, making it easier to generate and manipulate high-quality 3D models from minimal input.
limitations: No limitations are explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.3D Gaussian Splatting: **3D Gaussian Splatting** is a method of representing scenes using anisotropic Gaussian primitives, allowing for high-quality, real-time rendering of complex 3D scenes.
new_terms.Variational Autoencoder (VAE): **Variational Autoencoder (VAE)** is a generative model that learns complex data distributions by encoding data into a latent space and reconstructing it back to the original space.

open_sourcing: The implementation of the method and the trained models will be open-sourced.
